Enums.Name: TimeGranularity
Enums.Description: the time granularity of the data points.

Enums.Name: DataSchema

Values.Name: OneTable
Values.Description: OneTable means that your input data are all in one CSV file, which contains one 'timestamp' column and several variable columns. The default DataSchema is OneTable.

Values.Name: MultiTable
Values.Description: MultiTable means that your input data are separated in multiple CSV files, in each file containing one 'timestamp' column and one 'variable' column, and the CSV file name should indicate the name of the variable. The default DataSchema is OneTable.

Enums.Description: Data schema of input data source: OneTable or MultiTable. The default DataSchema is OneTable.

Enums.Name: FillNAMethod
Enums.Description: An optional field, indicating how missing values will be filled. One of Previous, Subsequent, Linear, Zero, Fixed.

Models.Name: UnivariateDetectionOptions
Models.Description: The request of entire or last anomaly detection.

Properties.Name: series
Properties.Description:
Time series data points. Points should be sorted by timestamp in ascending
order to match the anomaly detection result. If the data is not sorted
correctly or there is duplicated timestamp, the API will not work. In such
case, an error message will be returned.

ValueType.Name: TimeSeriesPoint
ValueType.Description: The definition of input timeseries points.

Properties.Name: timestamp
Properties.Description: Optional argument, timestamp of a data point (ISO8601 format).

Properties.Name: value
Properties.Description: The measurement of that point, should be float.

Properties.Name: granularity
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, can be one of yearly, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly,
minutely, secondly, microsecond or none. If granularity is not present, it will
be none by default. If granularity is none, the timestamp property in time
series point can be absent.

Properties.Name: customInterval
Properties.Description:
Custom Interval is used to set non-standard time interval, for example, if the
series is 5 minutes, request can be set as {"granularity":"minutely",
"customInterval":5}.

Properties.Name: period
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, periodic value of a time series. If the value is null or
does not present, the API will determine the period automatically.

Properties.Name: maxAnomalyRatio
Properties.Description: Optional argument, advanced model parameter, max anomaly ratio in a time series.

Properties.Name: sensitivity
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, advanced model parameter, between 0-99, the lower the value
is, the larger the margin value will be which means less anomalies will be
accepted.

Properties.Name: imputeMode
Properties.Description:
Used to specify how to deal with missing values in the input series, it's used
when granularity is not "none".

Properties.Name: imputeFixedValue
Properties.Description:
Used to specify the value to fill, it's used when granularity is not "none"
and imputeMode is "fixed".

Models.Name: UnivariateEntireDetectionResult
Models.Description: The response of entire anomaly detection.

Properties.Name: period
Properties.Description:
Frequency extracted from the series, zero means no recurrent pattern has been
found.

Properties.Name: expectedValues
Properties.Description:
ExpectedValues contain expected value for each input point. The index of the
array is consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: upperMargins
Properties.Description:
UpperMargins contain upper margin of each input point. UpperMargin is used to
calculate upperBoundary, which equals to expectedValue + (100 -
marginScale)*upperMargin. Anomalies in response can be filtered by
upperBoundary and lowerBoundary. By adjusting marginScale value, less
significant anomalies can be filtered in client side. The index of the array is
consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: lowerMargins
Properties.Description:
LowerMargins contain lower margin of each input point. LowerMargin is used to
calculate lowerBoundary, which equals to expectedValue - (100 -
marginScale)*lowerMargin. Points between the boundary can be marked as normal
ones in client side. The index of the array is consistent with the input
series.

Properties.Name: isAnomaly
Properties.Description:
IsAnomaly contains anomaly properties for each input point. True means an
anomaly either negative or positive has been detected. The index of the array
is consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: isNegativeAnomaly
Properties.Description:
IsNegativeAnomaly contains anomaly status in negative direction for each input
point. True means a negative anomaly has been detected. A negative anomaly
means the point is detected as an anomaly and its real value is smaller than
the expected one. The index of the array is consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: isPositiveAnomaly
Properties.Description:
IsPositiveAnomaly contain anomaly status in positive direction for each input
point. True means a positive anomaly has been detected. A positive anomaly
means the point is detected as an anomaly and its real value is larger than the
expected one. The index of the array is consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: severity
Properties.Description:
The severity score for each input point. The larger the value is, the more
sever the anomaly is. For normal points, the "severity" is always 0.

Models.Name: UnivariateLastDetectionResult
Models.Description: The response of last anomaly detection.

Properties.Name: period
Properties.Description:
Frequency extracted from the series, zero means no recurrent pattern has been
found.

Properties.Name: suggestedWindow
Properties.Description: Suggested input series points needed for detecting the latest point.

Properties.Name: expectedValue
Properties.Description: Expected value of the latest point.

Properties.Name: upperMargin
Properties.Description:
Upper margin of the latest point. UpperMargin is used to calculate
upperBoundary, which equals to expectedValue + (100 - marginScale)*upperMargin.
If the value of latest point is between upperBoundary and lowerBoundary, it
should be treated as normal value. By adjusting marginScale value, anomaly
status of latest point can be changed.

Properties.Name: lowerMargin
Properties.Description:
Lower margin of the latest point. LowerMargin is used to calculate
lowerBoundary, which equals to expectedValue - (100 - marginScale)*lowerMargin.

Properties.Name: isAnomaly
Properties.Description:
Anomaly status of the latest point, true means the latest point is an anomaly
either in negative direction or positive direction.

Properties.Name: isNegativeAnomaly
Properties.Description:
Anomaly status in negative direction of the latest point. True means the latest
point is an anomaly and its real value is smaller than the expected one.

Properties.Name: isPositiveAnomaly
Properties.Description:
Anomaly status in positive direction of the latest point. True means the latest
point is an anomaly and its real value is larger than the expected one.

Properties.Name: severity
Properties.Description:
The severity score for the last input point. The larger the value is, the more
sever the anomaly is. For normal points, the "severity" is always 0.

Models.Name: UnivariateChangePointDetectionOptions
Models.Description: The request of change point detection.

Properties.Name: series
Properties.Description:
Time series data points. Points should be sorted by timestamp in ascending
order to match the change point detection result.

Properties.Name: granularity
Properties.Description:
Can only be one of yearly, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly, minutely or
secondly. Granularity is used for verify whether input series is valid.

Properties.Name: customInterval
Properties.Description:
Custom Interval is used to set non-standard time interval, for example, if the
series is 5 minutes, request can be set as {"granularity":"minutely",
"customInterval":5}.

Properties.Name: period
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, periodic value of a time series. If the value is null or
does not present, the API will determine the period automatically.

Properties.Name: stableTrendWindow
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, advanced model parameter, a default stableTrendWindow will
be used in detection.

Properties.Name: threshold
Properties.Description:
Optional argument, advanced model parameter, between 0.0-1.0, the lower the
value is, the larger the trend error will be which means less change point will
be accepted.

Models.Name: UnivariateChangePointDetectionResult
Models.Description: The response of change point detection.

Properties.Name: period
Properties.Description:
Frequency extracted from the series, zero means no recurrent pattern has been
found.

Properties.Name: isChangePoint
Properties.Description:
isChangePoint contains change point properties for each input point. True means
an anomaly either negative or positive has been detected. The index of the
array is consistent with the input series.

Properties.Name: confidenceScores
Properties.Description: the change point confidence of each point

Models.Name: MultivariateDetectionResult
Models.Description: Detection results for the given resultId.

Properties.Name: resultId
Properties.Description: Result identifier, which is used to fetch the results of an inference call.

Properties.Name: summary
Properties.Description: Multivariate anomaly detection status.

Properties.Name: status
Properties.Description: Status of detection results. One of CREATED, RUNNING, READY, and FAILED.

Properties.Name: errors
Properties.Description: Error message when detection is failed.

ValueType.Name: ErrorResponse
ValueType.Description: ErrorResponse contains code and message that shows the error information.

Properties.Name: code
Properties.Description: The error code.

Properties.Name: message
Properties.Description: The message explaining the error reported by the service.

Properties.Name: variableStates
Properties.Description: Variable Status.

Properties.Name: variable
Properties.Description: Variable name in variable states.

Properties.Name: filledNARatio
Properties.Description: Proportion of missing values that need to be filled by fillNAMethod.

Properties.Name: effectiveCount
Properties.Description: Number of effective data points before applying fillNAMethod.

Properties.Name: firstTimestamp
Properties.Description: First valid timestamp with value of input data.

Properties.Name: lastTimestamp
Properties.Description: Last valid timestamp with value of input data.

Properties.Name: setupInfo
Properties.Description:
Detection request for batch inference. This is an asynchronous inference which
will need another API to get detection results.

Type.Name: MultivariateBatchDetectionOptions
Type.Description:
Detection request for batch inference. This is an asynchronous inference which
will need another API to get detection results.

Properties.Name: dataSource
Properties.Description:
Source link to the input data to indicate an accessible Azure storage Uri,
either pointed to an Azure blob storage folder, or pointed to a CSV file in
Azure blob storage based on you data schema selection. The data schema should
be exactly the same with those used in the training phase.

Properties.Name: topContributorCount
Properties.Description:
An optional field, which is used to specify the number of top contributed
variables for one anomalous timestamp in the response. The default number is
10.

Properties.Name: startTime
Properties.Description:
A required field, indicating the start time of data for detection, which should
be date-time of ISO 8601 format.

Properties.Name: endTime
Properties.Description:
A required field, indicating the end time of data for detection, which should
be date-time of ISO 8601 format.

Properties.Name: results
Properties.Description: Detection result for each timestamp.

Properties.Name: timestamp
Properties.Description: The timestamp for this anomaly.

Properties.Name: value
Properties.Description: The detailed value of this anomalous timestamp.

Type.Name: AnomalyValue
Type.Description: Detailed information of the anomalous timestamp.

Properties.Name: isAnomaly
Properties.Description: True if an anomaly is detected at the current timestamp.

Properties.Name: severity
Properties.Description:
Indicates the significance of the anomaly. The higher the severity, the more
significant the anomaly is.

Properties.Name: score
Properties.Description:
Raw anomaly score of severity, will help indicate the degree of abnormality as
well.

Properties.Name: interpretation
Properties.Description: Interpretation of this anomalous timestamp.

Properties.Name: variable
Properties.Description: Variable.

Properties.Name: contributionScore
Properties.Description:
This score shows the percentage contributing to the anomalous timestamp. A
number between 0 and 1.

Properties.Name: correlationChanges
Properties.Description: Correlation changes among the anomalous variables

Type.Name: CorrelationChanges
Type.Description: Correlation changes among the anomalous variables

Properties.Name: changedVariables
Properties.Description: The correlated variables that have correlation changes under an anomaly.

Properties.Name: errors
Properties.Description: Error message for the current timestamp.

Models.Name: ModelInfo
Models.Description:
Training result of a model including its status, errors and diagnostics
information.

Properties.Name: dataSource
Properties.Description:
Source link to the input data to indicate an accessible Azure storage Uri,
either pointed to an Azure blob storage folder, or pointed to a CSV file in
Azure blob storage based on you data schema selection.

Properties.Name: dataSchema
Properties.Description:
Data schema of input data source: OneTable or MultiTable. The default
DataSchema is OneTable.

Properties.Name: startTime
Properties.Description:
A required field, indicating the start time of training data, which should be
date-time of ISO 8601 format.

Properties.Name: endTime
Properties.Description:
A required field, indicating the end time of training data, which should be
date-time of ISO 8601 format.

Properties.Name: displayName
Properties.Description:
An optional field. The display name of the model whose maximum length is 24
characters.

Properties.Name: slidingWindow
Properties.Description:
An optional field, indicating how many previous timestamps will be used to
detect whether the timestamp is anomaly or not.

Properties.Name: alignPolicy
Properties.Description: An optional field, indicating the manner to align multiple variables.

Type.Name: AlignPolicy
Type.Description: An optional field, indicating the manner to align multiple variables.

Properties.Name: alignMode
Properties.Description:
An optional field, indicating how to align different variables to the same
time-range. Either Inner or Outer.

Properties.Name: fillNAMethod
Properties.Description:
An optional field, indicating how missing values will be filled. One of
Previous, Subsequent, Linear, Zero, Fixed.

Properties.Name: paddingValue
Properties.Description: An optional field. Required when fillNAMethod is Fixed.

Properties.Name: status
Properties.Description: Model status. One of CREATED, RUNNING, READY, and FAILED.

Properties.Name: errors
Properties.Description: Error messages when failed to create a model.

Properties.Name: diagnosticsInfo
Properties.Description: Diagnostics information to help inspect the states of model or variable.

Type.Name: DiagnosticsInfo
Type.Description: Diagnostics information to help inspect the states of model or variable.

Properties.Name: modelState
Properties.Description: Model status.

Properties.Name: epochIds
Properties.Description:
This indicates the number of passes of the entire training dataset the
algorithm has completed.

Properties.Name: trainLosses
Properties.Description:
List of metrics used to assess how the model fits the training data for each
epoch.

Properties.Name: validationLosses
Properties.Description:
List of metrics used to assess how the model fits the validation set for each
epoch.

Properties.Name: latenciesInSeconds
Properties.Description: Latency for each epoch.

Properties.Name: variableStates
Properties.Description: Variable Status.

Properties.Name: modelId
Properties.Description: Model identifier.

Properties.Name: createdTime
Properties.Description: Date and time (UTC) when the model was created.

Properties.Name: lastUpdatedTime
Properties.Description: Date and time (UTC) when the model was last updated.

Properties.Name: modelInfo
Properties.Description:
Training result of a model including its status, errors and diagnostics
information.

Properties.Name: models
Properties.Description: List of models.

Properties.Name: currentCount
Properties.Description: Number of trained multivariate models.

Properties.Name: maxCount
Properties.Description: Maximum number of models that can be trained for this Anomaly Detector resource.

Properties.Name: nextLink
Properties.Description: The link to fetch more models.

Properties.Name: variables
Properties.Description:
This contains the inference data, including the name, timestamps(ISO 8601) and
values of variables.

Properties.Name: variable
Properties.Description: Variable name of last detection request.

Properties.Name: timestamps
Properties.Description: Timestamps of last detection request

Properties.Name: values
Properties.Description: Values of variables.

Properties.Name: topContributorCount
Properties.Description:
An optional field, which is used to specify the number of top contributed
variables for one anomalous timestamp in the response. The default number is
10.

Properties.Name: variableStates
Properties.Description: Variable Status.

Properties.Name: results
Properties.Description: Anomaly status and information.

Models.Name: AnomalyDetectorError
Models.Description: Error information returned by the API.

Properties.Name: code
Properties.Description: The error code.

Properties.Name: message
Properties.Description: A message explaining the error reported by the service.

Parameters.Name: Endpoint
Parameters.Description:
Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example:
https://westus2.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

Operations.Name: DetectUnivariateEntireSeries
Operations.Summary: Detect anomalies for the entire series in batch.
Operations.Description:
This operation generates a model with an entire series, each point is detected
with the same model. With this method, points before and after a certain point
are used to determine whether it is an anomaly. The entire detection can give
user an overall status of the time series.

Operations.Name: DetectUnivariateLastPoint
Operations.Summary: Detect anomaly status of the latest point in time series.
Operations.Description:
This operation generates a model using the points that you sent into the API,
and based on all data to determine whether the last point is anomalous.

Operations.Name: DetectUnivariateChangePoint
Operations.Summary: Detect change point for the entire series
Operations.Description: Evaluate change point score of every series point

Operations.Name: GetMultivariateBatchDetectionResult
Operations.Description:
For asynchronous inference, get multivariate anomaly detection result based on
resultId returned by the BatchDetectAnomaly api.

Parameters.Name: resultId
Parameters.Description: ID of a batch detection result.

Operations.Name: TrainMultivariateModel
Operations.Summary: Train a Multivariate Anomaly Detection Model
Operations.Description:
Create and train a multivariate anomaly detection model. The request must
include a source parameter to indicate an externally accessible Azure blob
storage URI.There are two types of data input: An URI pointed to an Azure blob
storage folder which contains multiple CSV files, and each CSV file contains
two columns, timestamp and variable. Another type of input is an URI pointed to
a CSV file in Azure blob storage, which contains all the variables and a
timestamp column.

Headers.Name: location
Headers.Description: Location and ID of the model.

Parameters.Name: skip
Parameters.Description: Skip indicates how many models will be skipped.

Parameters.Name: top
Parameters.Description: Top indicates how many models will be fetched.

Operations.Name: DeleteMultivariateModel
Operations.Description: Delete an existing multivariate model according to the modelId

Operations.Name: GetMultivariateModel
Operations.Description:
Get detailed information of multivariate model, including the training status
and variables used in the model.

Operations.Name: DetectMultivariateBatchAnomaly
Operations.Description:
Submit multivariate anomaly detection task with the modelId of trained model
and inference data, the input schema should be the same with the training
request. The request will complete asynchronously and return a resultId to
query the detection result.The request should be a source link to indicate an
externally accessible Azure storage Uri, either pointed to an Azure blob
storage folder, or pointed to a CSV file in Azure blob storage.

Operations.Name: DetectMultivariateLastAnomaly
Operations.Summary: Detect anomalies in the last point of the request body
Operations.Description:
Submit multivariate anomaly detection task with the modelId of trained model
and inference data, and the inference data should be put into request body in a
JSON format. The request will complete synchronously and return the detection
immediately in the response body.
